intro: Chelone glabra var. elongata, commonly known as the slender hellebore, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features upright, slender stems that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, adorned with large, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
